channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: 3 TV Shows That Teach You New Hobbies and Skills
item.dc:creator: Mark McPherson
item.description: These are my favorite shows that taught me something new, with valuable skills worth learning.
item.content:encoded: Sometimes you want to get more out of streaming television than an enthralling story and a mindless time-waster of game shows and reality competition. Sometimes you want to learn something to understand the world better. We have a wealth of media at our fingertips, and we should be getting more out of it besides a few gasps and laughs.

item.title: 9 Practical Ways to Use the Linux seq Command
item.dc:creator: Haroon Javed
item.content:encoded: The seq command is far more than a simple number printer. It's a fundamental building block you can use for creating test files, controlling loops, performing network scans, and running mathematical calculations. Here are some common ways to use the seq command.

item.title: I Turned My Windows 11 PC Into a Streaming Hub With Plex, and You Can Too
item.dc:creator: Rich Hein
item.description: Plex promises to turn your PC into a streaming hub. I tested it on Windows 11 and here’s what I found.
item.content:encoded: I’ve been collecting digital media for decades, be it movies, TV shows, MP3s ripped from a few hundred of my old CDs, and more videos and pictures than I care to acknowledge. Between my wife and I, we’ve gone through nearly twenty phones over the years, and each one has left a trail of videos, photos and clips that I would prefer not to lose. All of this has left me with messy, undocumented archives scattered across PCs and hard drives. What I really want is one clean, intuitive hub I can share with family, something that feels like Netflix, not a jumble of random folders. That’s where Plex comes in.

item.title: How to Use the DROP Function in Microsoft Excel
item.dc:creator: Tony Phillips
item.description: Extract partial data from an array in Excel.
item.content:encoded: One of the most underused lookup and reference functions in Microsoft Excel is the DROP function. This powerful yet simple function lets you remove a specified number of rows or columns from the start or end of an array without altering the original dataset.

item.title: Notepad Is Starting to Feel a Little Overpowered (And I Like It)
item.dc:creator: Chifundo Kasiya
item.content:encoded: Many people love Notepad for its simplicity, but others avoid it for the same reason. Even though Microsoft has now blessed it with some extra features, it has become a more powerful plain-text editor. Well, I'm all for it.

item.title: Big Tech Takes On Cars: The Failure of Apple's Car Project
item.dc:creator: Brent vd Schyff
item.description: A secret project shrouded in mystery, billions spent, yet nothing to show. What went wrong with Apple's ambitious car plans?
item.content:encoded: Shrouded in secrecy from the outset, and which continued for a decade before Apple's car project came to light, ramping up, but ultimately met its demise: $10 billion spent and nothing to show but a sour taste for industry and shareholders, and a graveyard of ideas that ultimately never saw execution. But was Apple's failure the shake-up the industry needed, and what exactly went wrong?

item.title: The Best Free VPNs of 2025
item.dc:creator: Kris Henges
item.description: Looking for a dependable VPN that you can use for free? There isn't much out there, but we found five that will work.
item.content:encoded: Virtual private networks (VPNs) are great tools to keep safe online and access sites you otherwise can't, but most come with a price tag. However, there are a number of trustworthy VPN services that offer free VPN plans you can take advantage of.

item.title: 3 Netflix Shows You Need to Binge This Weekend (October 3 - 5)
item.dc:creator: Joe Keeley
item.description: Crave a weekend of fun? Just stream these shows!
item.content:encoded: Even if you think you've watched everything there is to see on Netflix, in my experience there are always a few more gems waiting to be discovered.

item.title: I’m Finally Ready to Leave Flagship Phones Behind
item.dc:creator: Sydney Butler
item.description: I'm ready for the SUVs of smartphones.
item.content:encoded: As I write this, I've been a flagship phone user for just over 10 years, starting with the LG G3 from 2014, which was my first taste of a high-end handset. Since then, I've had a Galaxy S8, Galaxy Note 10 Plus, Galaxy S21 Ultra, iPhone 11 Pro, Galaxy S22 Ultra, and, as of this moment, an iPhone 14 Pro.

item.title: Traveling Internationally? Roamless’s Easy-to-Use eSIM Is 20% Off
item.dc:creator: Kris Henges
item.description: If you're an international traveler, you'll want to pick up a Roamless eSIM.
item.content:encoded: With more carriers and phone manufacturers embracing eSIMs, it's time to consider what exactly they can do for you. One of the biggest advantages of an eSIM is that it allows you to easily use multiple SIMs with a single phone, making dual-simming incredibly easy.
